title: Nvidia unveils AI chips for video, software generation
snippet: Nvidia announced the upcoming release of a new AI chip, Rubin CPX, set to launch by the end of 2026 and designed for advanced workload like video generation and AI‑assisted software development. Weakness in current platforms addressed.

title: Nvidia Q2 revenue surges 56% YoY to $46.7B
snippet: Nvidia reported revenue for its second quarter ended July 27, 2025, of $46.7 billion, up 56% from a year ago, with data center demand driving growth. Whether margins can sustain the momentum is a key question.

title: Earnings beat expectations with strong margins
snippet: In its latest earnings, Nvidia beat street estimates, supported by strong margins and accelerating demand for its Blackwell architecture, although inventory and export risks remain.

title: Guidance raises hopes despite export control concerns
snippet: Nvidia projects strong future revenue, but export restrictions—especially around China—are cited as lingering risks by analysts.

title: Nvidia and AMD agree to pay 15% of China chip export revenues to US
snippet: Nvidia and AMD will pay the U.S. government 15% of their revenues from advanced chip sales to China in exchange for export licenses, in a deal easing previous restrictions.

title: Investors cautious ahead of August 27 earnings
snippet: With AI demand high, investors question whether the stock is overvalued. Export restrictions and forward guidance figured prominently in expectation setting.

title: China business remains risk amid licensing shifts
snippet: Nvidia’s business in China is constrained by export regulations, even as licensing begins under new terms—some revenue share, delays, and political risks remain.

title: Shares dip despite earnings beat
snippet: Despite strong financials, Nvidia shares slipped; concerns about AI chip spending bubble and growth in China weighed on sentiment post‑earnings.

title: Nvidia stock rises on shipments using Blackwell chips
snippet: Supermicro confirmed shipments of systems built on Nvidia’s new Blackwell Ultra chips, boosting confidence in hardware demand across AI infrastructure.

title: RTX 50‑series Super cards delayed until 2026
snippet: Nvidia’s RTX 50 series SUPER GPUs are reportedly postponed, with expected launch now likely in early 2026, following leaks and insider reports.

title: RTX 5090 prototype surfaces with 128GB VRAM
snippet: A prototype version of the RTX 5090 with 128GB of VRAM has been spotted, exceeding standard specs, likely catering to AI workloads demanding large memory capacity.

title: Nvidia asks Samsung to double GDDR7 production
snippet: To meet growing AI hardware demand, Nvidia has requested Samsung ramp up GDDR7 memory production significantly, especially as demand for memory bandwidth increases.

title: AI infrastructure spending remains strong but risks grow
snippet: Cloud providers continue heavy spending on AI infrastructure; however, geopolitical risks and margin pressures are top concerns among CFOs.

title: Missed China demand expectations despite policy easing
snippet: Even after some loosening of export restrictions, Nvidia’s China sales underperformed internal expectations, pointing to regulatory friction and local competition.

title: New GPU models target inferencing workloads
snippet: Nvidia is planning updated GPU models optimized for AI inference, focusing on efficiency and power usage—targeting edge datacenters and enterprise deployments.
